TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RegistrationConnectionType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the types of connections to a class object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The values in the RegistrationConnectionType enumeration are used in the `flags` parameter of the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationServices.RegisterTypeForComClients%2A> method. These values are the same as those defined in the COM **REGCLS** enumeration, which is used as the `flags` parameter in calls to the COM API `CoRegisterClassObject`.
For more information about `CoRegisterClassObject` and the **REGCLS** enumeration, see the MSDN library.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationConnectionType MultipleUse = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Multiple applications can connect to the class object through calls to .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationConnectionType MultiSeparate = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Registers separate CLSCTX_LOCAL_SERVER and CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER class factories.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationConnectionType SingleUse = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Once an application is connected to a class object with , the class object is removed from public view so that no other applications can connect to it. This value is commonly used for single document interface (SDI) applications.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationConnectionType Surrogate = int32(8)

Docs.summary: The class object is a surrogate process used to run DLL servers.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationConnectionType Suspended = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Suspends registration and activation requests for the specified CLSID until there is a call to .
